revised_title: Fossil Plants of Coal Measures: The Unity of Lepidodendra and Sigillaria
tldr: The author examines the structure and organization of fossil plants from the coal measures, specifically focusing on the Lycopodiaceae family, including Lepidodendra and Sigillaria. Through detailed analysis of various specimens, the author demonstrates the unity of these plants and their exogenous growth pattern. This study provides valuable insights into the anatomy and classification of ancient plant life.
